intro: Mercurialis annua subvar. euannua, commonly known as the common mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. The species is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
